home.LearnSpanishtitle: Learn Spanish while having fun at our boutique school
home.LearnSpanishdescription: At our boutique school based in Barcelona, EstoyOnline.es, we teach Spanish in a way that's very different from traditional methods—through fun and enjoyment. With our modern techniques, learning Spanish online becomes a truly enjoyable and engaging experience. Fun activities and games boost motivation, reduce stress, and make language learning easier. They also promote natural language use and help strengthen social bonds. Learning a language in a fun way not only improves retention but also enhances your overall language skills effectively. All our teachers are native Spanish speakers from Spain and Latin America. For beginner-level classes, we also have teachers who speak Turkish. All classes are held online via Zoom.
home.homeAboutDescription: I am the founder of EstoyOnline.es, a Spanish school with over 300 active students.
home.homeAboutDescription2: I can't wait to tell you all about our boutique school and online lessons. My Turkish is quite good :)
home.homeAboutDescriptionBold2: I look forward to your WhatsApp message.
home.homeSubAboutTitle: With our native Spanish-speaking teachers, you can learn Spanish naturally and enjoyably. We can't wait to meet you.
home.testimonies: What have our students said about us?

teachers.teachersTitle2: Let the sun warm your words

teacher.name: ALEJA
teacher.about: She lived in Istanbul for 10 years, working as a teacher at Saint Michel High School and the Cervantes Institute. She organized 'Solo hablamos Español' gatherings for those who wanted to practice Spanish. Throughout her teaching career, she improved her skills with international training courses like ELE, DELE, AVE, and Int House. In 2019, she moved to Spain and decided to start her own school. She developed modern, fun, and conversation-based methods for her school. She continues to improve the teaching process with her team of teachers, adapting new technologies and modern techniques to Spanish lessons. She reflects on which details to focus on by reviewing class recordings. She visits Turkey once a year to meet students in Istanbul, Izmir, Ankara, Bodrum, and Cappadocia. She loves tango and rowing off the coast of Barcelona. She enjoys improving her Turkish and continues to take advanced Turkish lessons.

teacher.name: CAROLINA
teacher.about: She is a passionate teacher who has worked at all educational levels. She lived in Patagonia, surrounded by nature, for 15 years, where she worked as a teacher and teacher trainer. Music is her other passion. She plays various instruments (guitar, keyboard, ukulele, etc.) and sings in choirs. She took musical comedy lessons and participated in many musicals. In 2021, she obtained a certification to teach Spanish to foreigners and began working online and in-person at various platforms and institutes. She emphasizes using games and alternative tools in conversation classes, private lessons, and regular courses to facilitate learning.

teacher.name: DANIELA
teacher.about: She is from Argentina and lives in Buenos Aires. She loves teaching. She began teaching Spanish to foreigners in 2004 and opened her own school in 2008, which became part of a university in 2015. In addition to her native Spanish, she speaks French, English, Portuguese, Hebrew, and Italian. She graduated in Communication Sciences and studied Literature at the University of Buenos Aires and Linguistics and French Literature at Tel Aviv University. In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her children, family, and traveling.

teacher.name: MELISSA
teacher.about: She was born and raised in Colombia and currently lives there. She worked as a librarian and taught library skills at all levels. She completed her master's degree in Béziers, France. Melissa learned Turkish long ago and speaks it at an advanced level. Since 2010, she has taught French, English, and Spanish at various academies (Oxford, Just English) and schools in Turkey (ISTEK in Antalya, Başarı in Kütahya, etc.). In her free time, she enjoys knitting dolls, singing with friends, and cooking. At our school, she teaches A1 beginner-level classes that require Turkish support.

teacher.name: SABRINA
teacher.about: She has always loved words. She adores reading and editing texts. She studied journalism and worked as a sports reporter on radio and in newspapers. Since 2011, she has been involved in CoPeHU pedagogical studies. She researched purposeful learning and attended creative writing workshops. In 2021, she combined her passions: communication, education, and cultural exchange. For this purpose, she obtained an ELE Spanish teaching certification. She used digital tools and games as teaching methods at various academies and e-learning platforms. In 2022, she began working at the Teacher Training Institute to train ELE teachers.

teacher.name: MAITA
teacher.about: Maita is an English and Spanish teacher. She received English education from a very young age. She studied architecture at university but discovered she wanted to be a language teacher and changed careers. She focused on personalized language teaching based on students' needs and improved her skills in this area through various courses. She is experienced in effectively using digital tools in her classes and emphasizes games as a teaching method. Another passion of hers is cooking. She loves exploring the intricacies of Spanish and Latin American cuisine.

teacher.name: ANITA
teacher.about: Anita is from Ecuador. She graduated in Communication from Universidad de las Américas in Quito and holds a certification in Spanish grammar and teaching methodology. She worked as a teacher at the Instituto Internacional de Español, gaining experience in teaching Spanish to foreigners. She worked at institutions like Just English, British Town Language Schools, and Likia Just Kids in Istanbul, teaching Turkish students at all levels. In recent years, she started giving private and group online lessons to students from different countries, allowing her to interact with diverse cultures. She is involved in graphic design and photography. She loves listening to music, salsa dancing, and traveling. At our school, she teaches A1 beginner-level classes that require Turkish support.

teacher.name: VIRGINIA
teacher.about: Virginia continued her life filled with literature by pursuing a teaching career. She studied at the University of Buenos Aires, completed her degree in literature, and became a language and literature teacher. For five years, she explored the rich culture of Italy. This experience deepened her understanding of literature. She currently teaches language and literature at a public school in Buenos Aires, sharing her love of literature with her students. She also teaches intermediate and advanced Spanish classes at our school. In her free time, she enjoys cycling through the streets of Buenos Aires and growing organic vegetables in her garden.

videos.title: A1.1 Beginner Level Spanish
videos.description: From the very first lesson at the beginner level, you start speaking Spanish.

videos.title: A1.1 Beginner Level Spanish
videos.description: Our students achieve basic speaking proficiency and use simple grammar structures within a few weeks.

videos.title: A1.1 Beginner Level Spanish
videos.description: At the beginner level, our teachers sometimes provide assistance in Turkish.

videos.title: A2.1 Basic Level Spanish
videos.description: By this level, our students have progressed enough to hold simple conversations.

videos.title: A2.1 Basic Level Spanish
videos.description: Our teachers use creative methods and everyday objects to ensure lessons are enjoyable.

videos.title: A2.2 Intermediate Level Spanish
videos.description: Students at the A2.2 level can make detailed descriptions with a broad vocabulary and comprehensive grammar usage.

videos.title: A2.3 Intermediate Level Spanish
videos.description: At the A2.3 level, dialogues reach a normal speaking pace, and specialized terms are used.

videos.title: B1.6 Advanced Level Spanish
videos.description: Advanced students have no difficulty understanding and using the fast-paced spoken Spanish.

videos.title: B1.6 Advanced Level Spanish
videos.description: Advanced students are now fully adapted to the speed of Spanish.

content.contentDescription: This course is for those new to Spanish. Some students may have learned some Spanish before or started with an app. However, a solid foundation must still be built from scratch. A small amount of Turkish is used in the first lessons, which is gradually reduced as students begin to understand Spanish.

Lessons are held online via Zoom once a week. Each lesson lasts 2.5 hours with a 15-minute break in the middle. All lessons are recorded, and students can download and review the recordings later. Lesson materials and all important information are stored in Google Classroom and can be accessed anytime.
There are two courses at the beginner level:
The A1.1 course totals 40 hours. (Standard course lasts 4 months, intensive course lasts 2 months)
The A1.2 course totals 30 hours. (Lasts 3 months)
Our teachers are very experienced and creative in teaching Spanish through fun. A native Spanish-speaking teacher who can speak Turkish at a basic level is assigned.

Each course has a maximum of 13 students. Before registration, a free trial lesson is conducted with each student to assess their Spanish level. During the trial lesson, other details about the course are shared, and all questions are answered (in Turkish). The trial lesson is free and lasts about 20 minutes. To schedule a trial lesson, please send us a WhatsApp message.
At the end of each course, an oral exam is conducted, and a certificate indicating the student's level is issued.

In intermediate and advanced courses, in addition to focusing on grammar and vocabulary, speaking and listening exercises are conducted. Fun applications are also used to evaluate each student's progress.
From the A1.2 level, students begin Spanish reading practice. Each student reads book chapters and shares them with classmates, improving fluency, learning new words, and gaining confidence in speaking. At more advanced levels, newspaper articles and essays are used to expand vocabulary.

Lessons are held online via Zoom once a week. Each lesson lasts 2.5 hours with a 15-minute break in the middle. All lessons are recorded, and students can download and review the recordings later. Lesson materials and all important information are stored in Google Classroom and can be accessed anytime. Each course lasts 30 hours. (3 months)
Teachers who can answer detailed grammar questions and have experience in intermediate/advanced level classes are assigned.

Each course has a maximum of 13 students. Before registration, a free trial lesson is conducted with each student to assess their Spanish level. During the trial lesson, other details about the course are shared, and all questions are answered. To schedule a trial lesson, please send us a WhatsApp message.
At the end of each course, an oral exam is conducted, and a certificate indicating the student's level is issued.

This course is designed for tourism sector employees who want to speak Spanish or those who want to use Spanish fluently for travel. It is an intensive course, making it suitable for those who want to learn Spanish very quickly. Three levels are taught in 4.5 months. You can start from scratch or from an intermediate level.
The course program follows the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR). Special Spanish materials for the tourism sector are used, with a focus on fluent speaking practice.

Lessons are held online via Zoom twice a week. Each lesson lasts 2.5 hours with a 15-minute break in the middle. All lessons are recorded, and students can download and review the recordings later. Lesson materials and all important information are stored in Google Classroom and can be accessed anytime. The entire course consists of 2 modules (180 hours total).
For those who have never learned Spanish or are just starting. It lasts 90 hours and covers A1.1, A1.2, and A2.1 levels. (Total duration: 4.5 months)

For those who can speak comfortably in the present tense and have learned the past tense (Pretérito Indefinido). If your Spanish level is at least A2.1, you can start with Module B. It lasts 90 hours and covers A2.2, A2.3, and A2.4 levels. (Total duration: 4.5 months)

Tourism 1 - SGEL publications • Tourism 2 - SGEL publications • Tourism Professionals - Enclave ELE publications • Welcome Back (A1-A2) - Enclave ELE publications. Teachers also use their own materials and conduct communicative exercises to strengthen speaking in every lesson.
Teachers have deep experience in ELE teaching. In Module A, a native Spanish-speaking teacher who can speak Turkish is assigned. In Module B, a native Spanish-speaking teacher is assigned.

Each course has a maximum of 13 students. Before registration, a free trial lesson is conducted with each student to assess their Spanish level. During the trial lesson, other details about the course are shared, and all questions are answered (in Turkish). The trial lesson is free and lasts about 20 minutes. To schedule a trial lesson, please send us a WhatsApp message.
At the end of each course, an oral exam is conducted, and a certificate indicating the student's level is issued.

Conversation and language practice courses aim to make speaking skills fluent for students who have passed the initial levels. Each lesson covers a different topic. This course teaches many words and terms on various subjects, focusing on everyday language use and intonation. Each student gets plenty of speaking practice opportunities. Conversation courses are offered at two different levels.
To join the beginner level, you must have completed the A1.1 course.
If you have completed the A2.1 level, you can join the more advanced conversation course.
Since the teachers for this course do not speak Turkish, real communication is established in Spanish. The course totals 16 hours. Each course has a maximum of 10 students.

content.contentTitle: B. Pasado Pisado - Spanish Past Tense Course
content.contentDescription:
In the Pasado Pisado Course, students focus on the three past tenses in Spanish (pretérito indefinido, pretérito imperfecto, and pretérito perfecto). The past tense is one of the topics that requires the most practice when learning Spanish. The grammar structure is examined in detail. Written and oral practice and speaking exercises are conducted. By the end of the course, you will start using the correct past tense fluently.
You must have completed the A1.2 level to join this course.
The course totals 16 hours. Each course has a maximum of 10 students.

content.contentTitle: C. Learn Spanish with Songs Course
content.contentDescription:
This course is for those who want to understand the lyrics of popular Spanish songs and learn new words and expressions while having fun. Understanding the music Spanish speakers listen to in their daily lives will greatly improve your language level. We will also explore the biographies of Latin American singers and practice speaking together. The teacher for this course is both a Spanish teacher and a professional musician.
You must have completed at least the A2.1 level to join this course.
The course totals 16 hours. Each course has a maximum of 10 students.

content.contentTitle: D. Amo El Subjuntivo - Subjunctive Mood Course
content.contentDescription:
The Amo el subjuntivo course is ideal for students who want to improve their Spanish levels and master this challenging topic. This course teaches all usage types of the subjunctive mood and its forms in different tenses. At the end of each topic, grammar practice and speaking exercises are conducted. The teacher is a philology expert.
You must have completed at least the A2.4 level to join this course.
The course totals 16 hours. Each course has a maximum of 10 students.

The Grammar is Beautiful course is for students who have reached a certain level in grammar but still cannot use it perfectly. Each lesson covers a different grammar topic, totaling 8 lessons. In the final lesson, all grammar topics covered during the course are reviewed to solidify your knowledge. The teacher has special training in intermediate-level grammar teaching.
Students who have completed the A2.2 level can join this course.
The course totals 16 hours. Each course has a maximum of 10 students.

Since no homework is assigned, joining complementary courses alongside regular lessons does not overwhelm students and greatly accelerates the learning process. Lessons are held online via Zoom once a week. Each lesson lasts 2 hours. All lessons are recorded, and students can download and review the recordings later. Lesson materials and all important information are stored in Google Classroom and can be accessed anytime.

Before registration, a free trial lesson is conducted with each student to assess their Spanish level. During the trial lesson, other details about the course are shared, and all questions are answered. To schedule a trial lesson, please send us a WhatsApp message.
There are no exams in these courses, so no certificates are issued.

Those over 14 years old take adult private lessons.
Those aged 6-13 take children's private lessons.

Private lessons are available for those whose schedules do not fit group lessons or who want to learn Spanish much faster. Adult private lessons are customized based on the student's interests and topics they are curious about. Video recordings of these lessons are not kept. Lesson times are arranged with the teacher. Adult private lessons last 1 hour, and you can have lessons twice a week if desired. The total number of lessons depends on your request. Your teacher will recommend the most suitable program for you.
In children's private lessons, vocabulary and grammar are taught through games, songs, and fun activities. The teacher-student relationship in children's lessons involves very different and special dynamics. Therefore, our teachers assigned specifically for children have deep experience working with kids. If parents request, lessons can be recorded. The teacher also sends a weekly progress report to the parents. Children's private lessons last 45 minutes.
Payments for private lessons are made in packages of 5 or 10 hours. For more details, please send us a WhatsApp message.

cards.title: Payments
cards.description: All payments are made by credit card.

cards.title: Refunds
cards.description: No refunds or course changes are allowed after lessons have started, even if you have not attended.

contact.needAssistance: You can write to us in Turkish...
contact.contactDescription: We look forward to your WhatsApp message for all your questions.
